subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# ''[[Angelica dahurica]]''
# [[orris]] [[root]]
# [[leaf]] of the [[iris]]
# [[leaf]] of the ''[[Angelica dahurica]]''

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
One of the 324 simplified characters introduced by the {{w|Republic of China}} ({{w|Kuomintang}} government) in 1935 as a simplified form of {{l|zh|藥}} but was later retracted in 1936.<!-- Refer https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:ROC24_SC2.jpg --> Prior to that <big>葯</big> and {{l|zh|藥}} were two homonyms that were not related with one another. <!-- Note: 葯 is not found as a variant form of 藥 in any historical dictionaries. -->

In the 1956 {{w|Chinese Character Simplification Scheme}} by the People's Republic of China, <big>葯</big> was once again listed as a simplified form of {{l|zh|藥}}<!-- Refer https://zh.wikisource.org/wiki/漢字簡化方案 --> which was succeeded by {{l|zh|药}} based on the radical simplification of {{l|zh|糹}} to {{l|zh|纟}}.<!-- Refer https://zh.wikisource.org/wiki/簡化字總表 (1964) or Section 3 of 漢字簡化方案 (1956) -->

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text:
* In modern Taiwan, <big>葯</big> is still considered a {{w|Variant Chinese character|variant form}} ({{l|zh|異體字}}) of {{l|zh|藥}}.
* In mainland China, {{l|zh|藥}}, rather than <big>葯</big> is listed officially as the traditional form of {{l|mul|药}}.
